Since its inception, PureSquare’s vision has always been about quality, freedom, and choice of connectivity underpinning most of the countries where you can connect without any kind of limitations.With PureSquare you can get instant access to 6,500+ fastest VPN Servers across 96+ locations worldwide. Now with the renewed focus, we are powering safety and consent at every level and layer of digital security. This is a senior role with a mix of managerial, strategical, and technical skills.You will command an experienced and strong squad formed of many technical people to generate and experiment ideas, scale and automate the successful strategies to unlock growth throughout the first phase of the customer funnel, fundamentally for Retention, Engagement and ReactivationResponsibilities Assist in define, test, and evaluate growth initiatives to improve retention rate and decrease churn. Period.Assist in identifying the opportunities on the product funnel and work together with product and engineering teams to experiment and implement changes to tackle more growth through harvesting, reactivation and building segmented approach.Assist in building and own Lifetime Value of the Customer based on strong Data science and Experimentation with the support of various teams.Work closely with digital marketing team to guide on targeting and new strategies to do reactivation retargeting through digital.Drive massive upticks in owned metrics.Understand and optimize loyalty and viral side to unlock growth.Work on a cross-functional growth hacker team that is responsible for driving user growth through experimentation and prototyping.Analyze and report growth success to the management aka build and manage dashboards to track metrics you defined for growth.Manage and optimize campaign budgets over different channels to bring efficient growth.Do whatever it takes to achieve exponential growth in all our markets or cities.

(The level of these will be tested via online test)You are good at data analytics and love making value out of data.You are very comfortable with writing scripts to automate data and reporting processes very effectively (big plus for HTML/CSS/JS skills or other programming languages)You will have a big plus if you have a know-how on relational database structures.You have a love of finding out of the box ways to solve problems.You have a solid track record of driving massive user growth at consumer-facing start-ups/large organizations and have high user empathy.You could seamlessly transition from high-level creative brainstorming to conducting and analyzing experiments and sweating the details.You have a deep understanding of large social web and mobile platforms & social/viral mechanics.You are team-focused and highly collaborative.You have an ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment.Super Fluent in English language, data analysis and productYou are obsessed with getting things done and finding a way to do it.

Knowledge of the Retail/FMCG industry within Middle EastKnowledge of research techniques and NIQ methodologies would be an advantageDetail oriented, excellent analytical skillsGood communication and presentation skillsAbility to work independently and in a teamGood interpersonal skills are a mustFluent in spoken and written English. Knowledge of Arabic is an added advantageProficient in Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, etc.) ,Knowledge of PowerBi or Tableau and Microsoft Dynamics would be an added advantage

Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Skyvera. Have you got what it takes?In the rapidly evolving telecommunications industry, businesses grapple with ever-increasing challenges, from complex operations to personalization of sales and customer success strategies. The need to streamline processes, enhance efficiency, and offer unparalleled customer experiences has never been more urgent.Skyvera is at the forefront of redefining the telecommunications industry through cloud-native solutions. We're taking it a step further by integrating generative AI to revolutionize our sales, customer success, professional services, and operations. Our vision doesn't merely touch upon improving existing structures. Instead, it emphasizes constructing AI-driven frameworks that transform our business's very core, ensuring we stay efficient and innovative.By developing AI-driven solutions, you will redefine our operations, lead the way in innovative customer experiences, and set the pace for Skyvera's next growth phase. You will shape our AI-centric future and position Skyvera as a trailblazer in the telecommunications industry.So, if you're excited about driving change, forging paths in uncharted AI terrains, and contributing meaningfully to a team determined to revolutionize the telecommunications landscape, apply now!What You Will Be Doing Proposing and conducting AI-driven experiments to enhance our sales, customer success, professional services, and operationsCreating best practice playbooks and guides that ensure our teams harness the power of generative AI effectivelyDeveloping and launching AI-powered solutions and products that redefine the way we do business
What You Won’t Be Doing Engaging in AI tasks that don't align with clear business objectivesGetting sidetracked by pursuits without tangible business outcomesSticking to outdated tech stacks that hinder innovation
AI-Augmented Software Developer Key Responsibilities Staying ahead of the AI curve by adopting, testing, and integrating the latest technologies to maximize our business value
Basic Requirements At least 3 years as a primary technical contributor in a team or software productHands-on experience leveraging generative AI for business operations or for a product you've developed or enhanced
About SkyveraSkyvera maintains your legacy, on-premise software, while reimagining its cloud-native future.There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!Working with CrossoverThis is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $100 USD/hour, which equates to $200,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.What to expect next: You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.
Important! If you do not receive an email from us: First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.

What Sets Us Apart:At SIB, we maintain deep insights into the dynamics of industries that our clients operate in. Our approach to understanding, quantifying and managing risk – be it existing or emerging, insurable or uninsurable – is informed by a multi-faceted reservoir of industry experience, sophisticated risk assessment capabilities and data-driven insights (including qualitative & quantitative benchmarking utilising industry leading datasets). We believe in continuously fortifying our industry-focused capabilities and providing holistic and innovative solutions that support our clients’ risk, human capital and insurance strategies.With SIB currently serving as AON’s exclusive long term Global Network Correspondent in Pakistan, we have the full weight of the giant behind us – and an established worldwide footprint that includes regional hubs of industry experts providing risk management and risk financing solutions, across a myriad of sectors. Our Legacy and the Future:The owners’ 3-generations of commitment to the insurance industry is a testament to SIB’s exemplary approach to client servicing in Pakistan. Since the setup of our very first office in 1987 and throughout the subsequent 35+ year journey, we have cemented our status as one of the oldest and most prominent insurance and reinsurance brokers in the country.SIB’s esteemed legacy will remain the foundations that undergird a new era of expansion. Our CEO’s historic 2019 management buyout of AON’s operations in Pakistan has changed the face of the company, setting the stage for maximal growth that comes with increased flexibility and the control to implement decisions rapidly. Leading from the front and backed by a team of 50 insurance professionals, CEO Khurram Alikhan takes pride in rolling up his sleeves to ensure we are always able to facilitate our clients’ needs.As Pakistan’s leading insurance and reinsurance broker, we have had the privilege and responsibility of shaping pivotal business decisions for some of the most impactful companies in the country. Our work has protected and enabled our clients’ growth in their respective industries, contributing significantly to major insurance cost savings for both nationals and multinationals. Most importantly, we are proud to have assisted in the protection of our clients’ workforce, assets and the integrity of their good name.The strides that SIB has made over 3 decades could not have been possible without the dedication & hard work of our remarkable team and network.POSITION: Actuary·      Qualified actuary (Bachelors in actuarial science, or statistics). ·      Proficient grasp of actuarial principles, risk management, and statistical modelling.·      Proficiency in actuarial software and tools such as excel, VBA, SAS, or R.·      Precise analytical skills and team player. ·      Problem-solving skills and a multi-tasker. ·      Excellent written and verbal communication skills.·      Prior internship or work experience in an actuarial role is preferred but not required.

About the job
            

 
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?At Trilogy, we're convinced that generative AI represents the future of coding. We see tools like Copilot, Cursor, and Code Interpreter as game-changers in the software industry, much like the Internet and Cloud Computing once were. Our vision is that significant portions of code that are written today tediously by hand will be mostly automated away by using generative AI.Why does this matter? Because with AI, you'll not only speed up the process of understanding and writing code but also produce standardized solutions, implement features more efficiently, experiment faster, and streamline testing. We believe developers working with this model will have a more rewarding job; they'll cover a broader scope and accomplish more in the same amount of time.This role is unique in our company. While our other engineering roles focus primarily on feature delivery, this position emphasizes developing a methodology for leveraging AI tools and patterns within the engineering process. The processes and methods you establish will benefit others, as they will be reused across teams.Besides this novel approach for your day-to-day work, you’ll also get a chance to work on some really exciting products: Crossover - an AI-powered hiring platform that sifts through millions of applicants per year to find the top 1% of global remote talent.gt.school - an online education platform that uses advanced data collection, algorithms, and AI-generated content to empower students to learn at their own pace.Data-driven Sales - an initiative that leverages data and AI algorithms to streamline the sales process across a portfolio of over 100 software products.
We're on the brink of an exhilarating journey with generative AI, and we want you to be a part of it. If you're eager to pioneer this transformation and play a pivotal role in the AI-driven future of software development, Trilogy is the place for you.What You Will Be Doing Proposing and conducting experiments with generative AI to enhance engineering processes, including problem decomposition, solution design, code generation, and advanced troubleshooting.Documenting best practices and techniques in playbooks and guides that enable others to harness the power of generative AI effectively.Using AI tools and techniques to develop and roll out actual features and products.Adopting, testing, and aggressively integrating new technologies, and standardizing a tech stack that genuinely boosts productivity.
What You Won’t Be Doing Developing completely new AI models - we are focusing our attention on reusing and/or finetuning existing models instead. Engaging in academic exercises without tangible outcomes or failing to deliver features and products.Getting stuck on a stagnant tech stack that neither changes nor innovates.
Basic RequirementsArtificial Intelligence Engineer key responsibilities Minimum 5 years of experience in software development.Minimum 3 years as a primary technical contributor for a development team or software product.Extensive hands-on experience using generative AI for software engineering tasks or in a product you built.
About TrilogyHundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!Working with CrossoverThis is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $100 USD/hour, which equates to $200,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.What to expect next: You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.
Important! If you do not receive an email from us: First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.

We are actively seeking a dedicated and experienced Client support specialist to join our team. If you are a confident, energetic professional with exceptional English communication skills, a background in client handling, and a track record of team management, we invite you to explore this opportunity. This is a role focused on client satisfaction and project coordination, and it does not involve sales targets.Position Overview:As a Lead Client Operations Coordinator, you will play a pivotal role in managing our relationships with international clients, working within the Eastern/Pacific time zones. We are particularly interested in local residents who can conveniently commute to our office. This role offers the potential for significant career growth and development.Key Responsibilities: Client Engagement: Cultivate strong client relationships by demonstrating exceptional communication skills. Engage with clients via phone or MS teams, attend meetings, capture and distribute meeting minutes, and act as a professional representative of our organization.Project Coordination: Effectively manage multiple projects and deadlines, coordinating with both clients and internal teams. Ensure that projects are completed within budget and specified timeframes while prioritizing client satisfaction as the ultimate goal.Primary Point of Contact: Serve as the primary point of contact for clients, facilitating seamless communication between clients and our internal teams. Provide dedicated support to clients on their projects and deliverables, addressing their needs promptly and professionally.Team Support: Collaborate with internal teams to support them in meeting their tasks and project requirements. Foster a cohesive working environment that promotes efficiency and excellence.Adaptability: Embrace change and adapt quickly to evolving situations, shifting priorities, and alterations in project direction. Demonstrate the ability to identify alternatives and devise effective contingency plans when necessary.Documentation: Document processes and procedures for enhanced clarity and efficiency. Assess situations in a timely manner and prioritize tasks effectively to meet project goals.Leadership: As the Lead Client Operations Coordinator, take a leadership role in mentoring and guiding junior team members. Encourage a positive and professional attitude within the team.Quality Assurance: Ensure the delivery of high-quality services to clients by conducting regular quality checks on deliverables and interactions. Implement improvements and best practices as needed.Data Analysis: Analyze client feedback and performance metrics to identify areas for improvement. Work with internal teams to implement enhancements that enhance client satisfaction and operational efficiency.Client Training: Develop and deliver client training sessions as needed to enhance their understanding of our processes and services, ensuring they can make the most of our offerings.Escalation Resolution: Act as the final point of contact for escalated client issues and concerns. Resolve conflicts or problems to maintain strong client relationships.Client Retention: Implement strategies to enhance client retention and loyalty. Identify opportunities for upselling or cross-selling our services to existing clients.Continuous Improvement: Champion a culture of continuous improvement by identifying areas where processes can be streamlined or made more efficient. Propose and implement changes to enhance operational effectiveness.
Qualifications: BS/MS degree is required. If you have training or experience in project management, your degree can be in any discipline.Training or experience in project management is highly valued.Exceptional English communication skills, both written and verbal.Previous experience in client coordination and call center operations.Strong organizational and time management skills.Ability to excel in a fast-paced, dynamic work environment.Reliability, a can-do attitude, and a commitment to exceeding client expectations.

Job Desception:
About the job
            

 
BackgroundIntroductionUN Women, grounded in the vision of equality enshrined in the Charter of the United Nations, works for the elimination of discrimination against women and girls; the empowerment of women; and the achievement of equality between women and men as partners and beneficiaries of development, human rights, humanitarian action and peace and security.In Pakistan, the agency’s work is guided by the UN Sustainable Development Cooperation Framework (UNSDCF) and the UN Women Pakistan Strategic Note (SN). In the context of advancing gender equality and women empowerment objectives, both key documents focus on the following five areas: (1) normative frameworks and data, (2) innovative gender financing, (3) protection against harmful practices, (4) awareness, voice, agency and leadership, and (5) women economic empowerment. While aligning perfectly with the Gender Equality and Women’s Empowerment outcome of the UNSDCF, the Strategic Note also recognizes the interconnectedness of various development goals and the pivotal role of gender equality in achieving sustainable development, as envisioned under the UNSDCF. It thus promotes the integration of a gender perspective across all sectors, fostering collaboration with government institutions, civil society organizations, and other stakeholders to implement gender-responsive policies and programs.Unlocking women’s economic potential in Pakistan remains a key area of focus for UN Women, and is in line with the priorities of the Government of Pakistan, as reflected in the latter’s framework for national development, the Pakistan Vision 2025. Vision 2025 plans for Pakistan to be “in the league of Upper Middle-Income countries by 2025” and “amongst the top ten economies of the world by 2047”. Any solution to Pakistan’s economic and social problems cannot succeed without including its women, who make up 48.5 percent of the total population of the country and are thus indispensable to its future growth story. To achieve these goals, it is paramount that Pakistani women are enabled to reach their full potential by virtue of active participation in economic life.JustificationVarious initiatives by key government departments and institutions, including the State Bank of Pakistan (SBP), the Securities and Exchange Commission of Pakistan (SECP) and the Small and Medium Enterprises Development Authority (SMEDA), are reflective of the focus on the economic empowerment of women. In this regard, SMEDA, has also established a Women Entrepreneurship Development Cell (WED Cell) to address gender-specific challenges and promote gender mainstreaming.The primary objective of the WED Cell is to highlight the unique obstacles faced by women entrepreneurs and create an enabling environment that optimizes their success at every stage of business development, consolidation, and growth. WED Cell also facilitates communication and collaboration among decision-makers, government agencies, donors, and women entrepreneurs, to strengthen the overall framework for women's entrepreneurship by making recommendations and proposing strategies to reduce barriers and enhance support mechanisms for women entrepreneurs.However, through experiences and the lessons learned from the National SME Policy 2021, and the findings of a recent Diagnostic Study on Key Barriers to Women Entrepreneurs in Pakistan, there is a need for a dedicated Women Entrepreneurship Development (WED) policy, accompanied by collective efforts and a supportive ecosystem. Such a policy is crucial for sustainable and inclusive economic growth and business consolidation in the women micro, small and medium enterprises (MSME) sector.Recognizing the significant potential and untapped opportunities that lies within women entrepreneurship, UN Women aims to support SMEDA to develop a comprehensive Women Entrepreneurship Development Policy to harness this potential and foster women entrepreneurship in Pakistan. The policy will aim at addressing the unique challenges faced by women entrepreneurs, including but not limited to access to finance, capacity building, market linkages, legal and regulatory barriers, and gender biases, with a special focus on microenterprises. It will serve as a roadmap for government interventions, programs, support mechanisms, and the creation of a conducive environment that empowers women entrepreneurs to thrive.ObjectivesThe overall objective of this assignment is to develop a women entrepreneurship development policy and enhance the technical and financial capacities of the organization to design and implement policy effectively. This will enable SMEDA to maximize its impact in women MSME space and contribute significantly to the economic empowerment of women entrepreneurs.Duties And ResponsibilitiesDuties and ResponsibilitiesWorking under the overall guidance of the Portfolio Manager – Women Economic Empowerment and the direct supervision of Senior Planning, Monitoring & Reporting Officer, the Technical Advisor – Women Entrepreneurship Policy is expected to deliver the following; Engage and build partnerships with development partners for Women Entrepreneurship Development PolicyDevelop a WED Policy that addresses women entrepreneurs (including micro-entrepreneurs) issues, builds support mechanisms and a conducive ecosystem.Design action plans, frameworks, development models & processes, and gender-responsive programs nationwide in line with the policy recommendations.Establish a robust monitoring and evaluation framework.Strengthen the capacities of SMEDA WED Cell to carry out the policy development process and to coordinate implementation of its accompanying action plan effectively.
Key DeliverablesThe scope of work includes:  Conducting a thorough review of existing policies, reports, and studies related to women entrepreneurship in Pakistan. Collecting and analyzing data on the current status, challenges, and opportunities for women entrepreneurs in various sectors. Assessing the specific challenges faced by women entrepreneurs, including but not limited to demand and supply side issues, gender biases, and legal and regulatory barriers, etc. Conduct a stakeholder analysis and engage with relevant government ministries & agencies, women entrepreneurs, business associations, NGOs, civil society organizations, and other key stakeholders to gather inputs and insights. Benchmarking international best practices in women entrepreneurship policies and identifying relevant lessons for Pakistan. Identifying specific policy interventions, programs, and support mechanisms that can be implemented to support women entrepreneurs within the following focus areas;Women MSMEs DefinitionRegulatory & Tax EnvironmentWomen MSMEs Supply Side Challenges Access to FinanceSkills, Human Resource & TechnologyInfrastructureEntrepreneurship, Innovation & IncubationBusiness Development Services
Women MSMEs Demand Side Challenges Market AccessPublic Procurement
Developing a comprehensive policy framework that addresses the identified gaps and incorporates the best practices.Developing an implementation plan with clear timelines, resources, and responsibilities for various stakeholders.Preparing a monitoring and evaluation mechanisms with indicators to assess and track the impact of the policy and make necessary adjustments.Prepare a comprehensive report outlining the policy framework, interventions, and implementation plan, along with recommendations for effective policy implementation.Delivering a final report that includes the policy document, implementation plan, and other relevant outputs.
CompetenciesCore Values: Respect for Diversity, Integrity, and ProfessionalismCore Competencies: Awareness and Sensitivity Regarding Gender Issues; Accountability; Creative Problem Solving; Effective Communication; Inclusive Collaboration; Stakeholder Engagement and Leading by ExampleRequired Skills And ExperiencePayment Schedule:This is a Daily Rate based contract The Consultant will be required to work  three days every week  from the SMEDA Office. Any changes to the choice of days within the week, and work from home arrangements will require prior approval.DurationDuration is 1 year.Qualifications: Master’s degree or equivalent in international development, business administration, social sciences, human rights, gender/women's studies, or a related field is required.A first-level university degree in combination with two additional years of qualifying experience may be accepted in lieu of the advanced university degree.
Skills and Competencies: Minimum 10 years of progressively responsible experience at the national or international level in international development, coordination, development finance or planning.Excellent analytical, writing, editing, presentation, facilitation, and documentation skills in English.Proven ability to establish, build and sustain effective relationships with government agencies, development partners, civil society organizations along with community level women organizations.Knowledge on local entrepreneurship programs and projects specifically supporting women entrepreneurship.
Language Requirement: Fluency in English is requiredKnowledge of the other UN official working language is an asset;
Application: All applications must include (as an attachment) the completed UN Women Personal History form (P11)which can be downloaded fromhttps://www.unwomen.org/sites/default/files/Headquarters/Attachments/Sections/About%20Us/Employment/UNWomenP11PersonalHistoryForm.docKindly note that the system will only allow one attachment. Applications without the completed UN Women P11form will be treated as incomplete and will not be considered for further assessment.HEC Attested degrees are a prerequisite for employment at UN. During the recruitment process candidates may be required topresent HEC attested degrees.Foreign Qualified Candidates: Foreign degree holders shall be required to (i) Present a verification/certification letter from theuniversity verifying the degree & student enrollment, or (ii) Foreign degree Equivalence Letter from HEC.At UN Women, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment of mutual respect. UN Women recruits, employs,trains, compensates, and promotes regardless of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, ability, nationalorigin, or any other basis covered by appropriate law.All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, competence, integrity and organizational need. If you need any reasonableaccommodation to support your participation in the recruitment and selection process, please include this information in yourapplication.UN Women has a zerotolerance policy on conduct that is incompatible with the aims and objectives of the United Nations and UNWomen, including sexual exploitation and abuse, sexual harassment, abuse of authority and discrimination.All selected candidates will be expected to adhere to UN Women’s policies and procedures and the standards of conduct expected ofUN Women personnel and will therefore undergo rigorous reference and background checks. (Background checks will include theverification of academic credential(s) and employment history. Selected candidates may be required to provide additional information toconduct a background check.)If you are experiencing difficulties with online job applications, please contact the eRecruit Helpdesk.Refer a Friend Apply Now

We believe the key to success is a robust, customer-obsessed support organization led by decision-makers with elite customer-facing experience. This role is the highest-level customer support engineer we have. The problems are complex. It’s an immense responsibility, but one that can put you on the fast track to career advancement.We want our customer service quality to be the #1 reason our customers continue to partner with us year after year. If you’re looking to rapidly improve your skill set and take your career to the next level, then we invite you to join our advanced technical support team to see how we’re transforming telco!What You Will Be Doing Impressing customers by solving new and complex problems proactivelyBuilding on your existing technical capabilities and regularly adding new skills and product knowledge to your toolkit

About SkyveraSkyvera maintains your legacy, on-premise software, while reimagining its cloud-native future.There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!Working with CrossoverThis is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $15 USD/hour, which equates to $30,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.What to expect next: You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.
Important! If you do not receive an email from us: First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.

Job DescriptionBackgroundDiversity, Equity and Inclusion are core principles at UNDP: we value diversity as an expression of the multiplicity of nations and cultures where we operate, we foster inclusion as a way of ensuring all personnel are empowered to contribute to our mission, and we ensure equity and fairness in all our actions. Taking a ‘leave no one behind’ approach to our diversity efforts means increasing representation of underserved populations. People who identify as belonging to marginalized or excluded populations are strongly encouraged to apply. Learn more about working at UNDP including our values and  inspiring stories.UNDP does not tolerate sexual exploitation and abuse, any kind of harassment, including sexual harassment, and discrimination. All selected candidates will, therefore, undergo rigorous reference and background checks.UNDP Pakistan works with the Government of Pakistan, civil society, national partners and the people of Pakistan to help find solutions to persistent development challenges. We work to build lasting institutional capacity, provide technical expertise to improve development outcomes, and help link the Government and people of Pakistan to innovative global solutions in areas such as improved data quality and collection, better environmental management, climate change finance and adaptation, strong and accountable governance mechanisms and capacities to respond effectively to conflict and disasters.The UNDP Country Office in Pakistan provides a range of administrative services in support of the UNDP programme implementation and other UN Agencies including the UN Resident Coordinator Office (RCO). The following main service areas are covered: human resources, procurement, finance, ICT, security, and administration such as premises and common services management, protocol, visa facilitation, travel, and similar services.UNDP Pakistan manages Common Premises and Common services in several locations including Serena Business Complex in Islamabad, UN Common Premises in Peshawar, and Quetta as the lead agency. The collocated clients include more than 10 UN Agencies and UNDP development projects.Under the guidance and direct supervision of General Administrative Analyst/Head of General Admin Unit (GAU), the Common Premises/Services Analyst provides variety of services to execute complex inter-related operational and administrative activities aimed to successful provision of the common premises linked common services.The Common Premises and Services Analyst is expected to analyze and interpret the operations rules and regulations and provides solutions to a wide spectrum of complex issues in the common premises/services management areas. The incumbent promotes a collaborative, client-focused, quality and results-oriented approach in working with UNDP CO units, Projects, and Programmes; UN Agencies and co-located organizational units as the UNDP’s main clients and the partners.The Common Premises/Services Analyst is required to work in close cooperation with all Operations and Programme Units with special emphasis given to the UNDP ICT team regarding the common ICT services and Security Unit in provision of premises security services. The incumbent supervises common premises support personnel (4) in Islamabad and provides matrix management to common premises support staff in Peshawar (1) and Quetta (1).Duties And ResponsibilitiesUnder the overall guidance from the Operations Manager, the Common Premises/Services Analyst directly reports to Head of GAU/General Admin Analyst. The incumbent is expected to work closely with all UNDP Operations and Programme Units, UNOMT, UN Agencies and external parties who are involved in common premises and services.The Common Premises/Services Analyst supervises common services support staff.ResponsibilitiesThe incumbent will be directly responsible for successful completion of the below set of tasks within allotted, agreed-upon time frame under the overall guidance of the General Administrative Analyst/GAU Head of UNDP Pakistan COThe Common Premises/Services Analyst will be responsible for day-to-day smooth management of Common Premises and relevant services.Ensures smooth management of the Common Premises and Common services in line with the UNDP Programme Operations Policy and Procedures: Ensures timely preparation of Common Premises/Services AWP (inclusive of procurement, HR plans for the year), annual budgets and cost recovery systems for agreed common services between the collocated UN Agencies and organizational units. Ensures smooth implementation of the AWP approved by the UN Common Premises Management Committee and other respective approving authorities. Ensures transparency and reporting on revenues, budgets, cost recovery, cost sharing, performance against service level standards, and other measures as may be agreed. Serves as Secretary to the Common Premises Operations team and Management Committee meetings by providing full support to organise the required meetings on regular basis and ensuring inclusiveness of all co-located UN Agencies and other offices in critical matters relating to management of Common services and premises 
Efficient and cost-effective administration of common services Manages the common services/building management support personnel with the highest integrity while ensuring the client-oriented services provision. Timely preparation of unit work plans, annual performance plans and reviews for both UN staff and contracted personnel. Develop Common services business process mapping and establishment of internal Standard Operating Procedures to document all critical workflows. Serves as the primary focal point to communicate with the facilities management contractors on provision of respective services while ensuring cost effective, safe, environmentally sustainable, and efficient premises and infrastructure services. Provides technical analysis and makes recommendations to the GAU Head to ensure efficient premises maintenance and repair priorities are executed in a timely manner for CO and Common Premises. Monitor and prepare regular management reports of expenditures of common servicesPerforms roles and responsibilities as assigned as per the CO ICF and use of UNALL, Quantum or any other corporate tools as necessary. Timely monitoring and execution of corrective actions as needed for all common premises/services transactions. Supports the CO asset and inventory management and periodic certifications as the common asset focal point. Ensures efficient contract management is in place for all LTA holders for the premises/services related services contracts as per the approved AWP. Ensures the CO warehouse management is aligned with the policy and procedure. 
Support to UN Efficiency Agenda: BOS, Common Premises, Common Back Office, and overall Business efficiency Provides support to the GAU Head on annual review and update of UN BOS Pakistan on all common admin and common premises relevant data/information for further harmonization of operations across UN Agencies. Contributes to up-to-date Business Continuity Plan (including annual BCP testing working closely and in coordination with BCP focal points at the CO or UN OMT when needed. Supervises and coordinates the facility management contracts with external service providers, ensuring quality management against key performance indicators and service level agreements, contract cost control, technical performance, health and safety management, risk management, disaster preparedness and contingency planning while ensuring best industry standards in terms of premises operations. Foster a culture of innovation and continuing critical review of cost vs performance parameters. Provides analysis and recommendations on life cycle costs and compliance with UN and local standards and norms relating to the operation and maintenance of upcoming UNH and existing SBC and Common Premises buildings to ensure energy conservation and environmental sustainability. Serves as the EMT focal point for common premises management areas. 
Ensures facilitation of knowledge building and knowledge sharing in the CO focusing on achievement of the following results: Organization and facilitation of trainings for the business efficiency, greening, environmental management, use of various innovative tools and contribution to sound contributions to knowledge networks and communities of practice.The incumbent performs other duties within their functional profile as needed necessary for the efficient functioning of the office. 
The incumbent of the position will uphold the non-discriminatory behaviour and ensure that: Human rights and gender equality is prioritized as an ethical principle within all actions. Activities are designed and implemented in accordance with “Social and Environmental Standards of UNDP”. Any kind of diversities based on ethnicity, age, sexual orientation, disability, religion, class, gender is respected within all implementations including data production.Differentiated needs of women and men are considered. Inclusive approach is reflected within all actions and implementations, in that sense an enabling and accessible setup in various senses such as disability gender language barrier is created. Necessary arrangements to provide gender parity within all committees, meetings, trainings, etc. 
CompetenciesCore competencies Achieve Results : LEVEL 2: Scale up solutions and simplifies processes, balances speed and accuracy in doing workThink Innovatively : LEVEL 2: Offer new ideas/open to new approaches, demonstrate systemic/integrated thinkingLearn Continuously : LEVEL 2: Go outside comfort zone, learn from others and support their learningAdapt with Agility : LEVEL 2: Adapt processes/approaches to new situations, involve others in change processAct with Determination : LEVEL 2: Able to persevere and deal with multiple sources of pressure simultaneouslyEngage and Partner : LEVEL 2: Is facilitator/integrator, bring people together, build/maintain coalitions/partnershipsEnable Diversity and Inclusion : LEVEL 2: Facilitate conversations to bridge differences, considers in decision making 
Cross-functional &Technical competenciesBusiness Development Knowledge Generation : Ability to research and turn information into useful knowledge, relevant for context, or responsive to a stated needIntegration within the UN : Ability to identify, and integrate capacity and assets of the UN system, and engage in joint work; knowledge of the UN System and ability to apply this knowledge to strategic and/or practical situations 
Business Management Communication : Ability to communicate in a clear, concise, and unambiguous manner both through written and verbal communication; to tailor messages and choose communication methods depending on the audience. Ability to manage communications internally and externally, through media, social media, and other appropriate channels 
Administration & Operations (Technical Competencies) Assets management : Knowledge of policy & procedures on PP&E; ability to prepare financial statements on PP&E; maintain 16 UNDP | People for 2030 –Competency Framework –Technical Competencies Asset Management Module in ATLAS, Asset Dashboard; develop supporting tools for assets certification and further enhancements form module; design and run training programs, etc. on assets management and assets recording; run AP-AM interface; perform AP-AM-GL reconciliation; perform analytical review of AM reports and asset information to ensure completeness and accuracy of asset informationBuilding, facilities & office space management : Knowledge and ability to facilitate the renovation and upgrade of offices including review of complex engineering/architectural drawings; negotiate technical agreements to ensure fully operational building infrastructure and services; design policy & procedure (POPP) for premises and facilities including space standards; manage premises and facilities; validate financial statement notes on leasehold data
Business Direction and Strategy(Cross Functional Competencies) System Thinking : Ability to use objective problem analysis and judgement to understand how interrelated elements coexist within an overall process or system, and to consider how altering one element can impact on other parts of the system
Business Management (Cross Functional Competencies) Resource Management : Ability to allocate and use resources in a strategic or tactical Za\ in line with principles of accountability and integrity
EducationRequired Skills and Experience Advanced university degree (master's degree or equivalent) in Business Administration, Public Administration, Finance, Economics or related field is required, or A first-level university degree (bachelor’s degree) in combination with an additional two years of qualifying experience will be given due consideration in lieu of the advanced university degree.
Experience Up to 2 years (with master’s degree) or 2 years (with bachelor’s degree) of relevant experience at the National or International level.Proven experience of managing and administering common premises and services Demonstrated experience of working in complex environment with multiple stakeholders Demonstrated ability to work in a multicultural, multi ethnic environment and to maintain effective working relations with people of different national and cultural backgrounds.Experience in the usage of computers and office software packages (MS Word, Excel, etc.) and advance knowledge of spreadsheet and database packages, experience in handling of web-based management systems and ERP financialsKnowledge of United Nations Business Operations Strategy (BOS)UN Common Premises management concept is desirableStrong financial and administrative background handling similar size and complexity of a project to the one of UNDP managed common premises 
Language Requirement Excellent written and verbal English and Urdu are required.

Job Desception:
About the job
            

 
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?At Trilogy, we're convinced that generative AI represents the future of coding. We see tools like Copilot, Cursor, and Code Interpreter as game-changers in the software industry, much like the Internet and Cloud Computing once were. Our vision is that significant portions of code that are written today tediously by hand will be mostly automated away by using generative AI.Why does this matter? Because with AI, you'll not only speed up the process of understanding and writing code but also produce standardized solutions, implement features more efficiently, experiment faster, and streamline testing. We believe developers working with this model will have a more rewarding job; they'll cover a broader scope and accomplish more in the same amount of time.This role is unique in our company. While our other engineering roles focus primarily on feature delivery, this position emphasizes developing a methodology for leveraging AI tools and patterns within the engineering process. The processes and methods you establish will benefit others, as they will be reused across teams.Besides this novel approach for your day-to-day work, you’ll also get a chance to work on some really exciting products: Crossover - an AI-powered hiring platform that sifts through millions of applicants per year to find the top 1% of global remote talent.gt.school - an online education platform that uses advanced data collection, algorithms, and AI-generated content to empower students to learn at their own pace.Data-driven Sales - an initiative that leverages data and AI algorithms to streamline the sales process across a portfolio of over 100 software products.
We're on the brink of an exhilarating journey with generative AI, and we want you to be a part of it. If you're eager to pioneer this transformation and play a pivotal role in the AI-driven future of software development, Trilogy is the place for you.What You Will Be Doing Proposing and conducting experiments with generative AI to enhance engineering processes, including problem decomposition, solution design, code generation, and advanced troubleshooting.Documenting best practices and techniques in playbooks and guides that enable others to harness the power of generative AI effectively.Using AI tools and techniques to develop and roll out actual features and products.Adopting, testing, and aggressively integrating new technologies, and standardizing a tech stack that genuinely boosts productivity.
What You Won’t Be Doing Developing completely new AI models - we are focusing our attention on reusing and/or finetuning existing models instead. Engaging in academic exercises without tangible outcomes or failing to deliver features and products.Getting stuck on a stagnant tech stack that neither changes nor innovates.
Basic RequirementsAI Super Engineer key responsibilities Minimum 5 years of experience in software development.Minimum 3 years as a primary technical contributor for a development team or software product.Extensive hands-on experience using generative AI for software engineering tasks or in a product you built.
About TrilogyHundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. We’re looking for ambitious self-starters who want to be part of our vision and create a positive legacy.Your CommunityThe Admissions team is responsible for managing the Application & Acceptance processes, Visa, and their relevant procedures to deliver a customer-focused service to our recruitment partners, universities, and institutions.Your PositionThe Senior Officer Quality Assurance - Admissions will be responsible for ensuring the quality of the student recruitment process, monitoring and improving the performance of recruiters and partner universities, identifying bottlenecks in the admission process, maintaining quality assurance frameworks, and ensuring compliance with all relevant laws and regulations. The officer will also provide support to regional teams and onshore by sharing different reports to help them run their business effectively. This position may require to travel occasionally.Your Backstory Bachelor's degree in any field.Minimum of 5 years experience in international student recruitment, with a strong knowledge of admission processes, regulations, and compliance requirements pertaining to North America.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.Demonstrated ability to work independently and as part of a team.Strong project management skills.Excellent attention to detail and accuracy.Ability to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and CRM software.
Your Contribution Develop and maintain quality assurance frameworks to ensure that the recruitment process is efficient, effective, and compliant with applicable laws and regulations.Monitor and evaluate the performance of recruiters and provide feedback to improve their performance. Conduct audits of the recruitment process to ensure compliance with all relevant policies and regulations.Monitor and evaluate the performance of partner universities, and provide feedback to improve the conversions and enrolments. Identify any bottlenecks in the admission process and propose alternative solutions based on the performance, turnaround time, and profitability.Provide support to regional teams by sharing different reports to help them run their business in India & South Asia effectively.Develop and provide regular reports to track key performance indicators, recruitment trends, and other relevant information.Stay up-to-date with industry trends and developments in the international student recruitment space.Develop and maintain positive relationships with key stakeholders, including recruiters, partner universities, and regional and partnership teams.
At Adventus.io, our partners come from all walks of life and so do we. We hire great people from a variety of backgrounds, not just because it’s the right thing to do, but because diversity makes us even greater. We want you to be you so welcome the unique contributions that you can bring regardless of your education, culture, ethnicity, race, sex, gender.

Overview: We are seeking a 4+ years experienced Data Migration Senior Consultant to join our team. The ideal candidate will possess deep technical expertise in Azure Data Factory pipelines, SSIS (SQL Server Integration Services), SQL database management, and a solid understanding of basic database design concepts. You will play a crucial role in ensuring the successful migration of data across various systems while maintaining data integrity andperformance. Key Responsibilities: 1. Data Migration Planning: Collaborate with clients and project teams to assess data migration needs, define migration strategies, and develop detailed migration plans. 2. Azure Data Factory Expertise: Design, develop, and manage data pipelines using Azure Data Factory to facilitate efficient and secure data migration processes.  3. SSIS Proficiency: Leverage SSIS to extract, transform, and load (ETL) data between various source and target systems, ensuring data accuracy and consistency. 4. SQL Database Management: Manage SQL databases, including schema design, optimization, and performance tuning, to support data migration activities. 5. Data Mapping and Transformation: Define data mapping rules and transformation logic to ensure data is migrated accurately and in accordance with business requirements 6. Data Quality Assurance: Implement data validation and quality checks to identify and rectify data inconsistencies or anomalies during migration. 7. Monitoring and Troubleshooting: Monitor data migration processes, identify and address issues promptly, and optimize performance for large-scale data transfers 8. Documentation: Maintain detailed documentation of data migration processes, including source-to target mappings, ETL workflows, and data lineage. 9. Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data analysts, developers, and business stakeholders, to ensure successful data migration outcomes.  10. Best Practices: Stay current with industry best practices and emerging technologies in data migration and database management. Qualifications:  Bachelor's degree in a related field (e.g., Computer Science, Information Systems).Proven experience as a Data Migration Consultant, with a focus on Azure Data Factory,SSIS, SQL database management, and database design concepts.Strong proficiency in Azure Data Factory pipelines and SSIS development.Extensive experience with SQL database management and optimization.Familiarity with database design principles and data modelling.Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills.Strong communication and interpersonal skills for effective collaboration with clients and teams.Relevant certifications in Azure Data Factory or SSIS are a plus.

You’ve probably experienced this at some point if you’re lucky: you’ve been so engrossed in something that time’s flown by, the day has turned to night, and you’ve had the time of your life. That’s the kind of learning that generates scientists, inventors, and changemakers.And so, eight years ago, we became obsessed with the idea of making all children in Pakistan fall in love with learning. We knew that if we cracked this, we could turn around Pakistan. Our dreamis that a Pakistani kid from the slums/villages will develop the next vaccine, or land on Mars one day.Position Overview:We are actively seeking an experienced and innovative Senior Innovation Specialist to lead and shape our products innovation endeavors. In this role, you will be instrumental in driving forward our innovation initiatives within the Product team, ensuring they align with market dynamics and customer needs. User-Centric Design:* Develop and execute first-rate user experiences and support solutions that prioritize user satisfaction and evolving needs.* Continuously iterate and improve designs based on user feedback and data-driven insights.4. Cultural Relevance:* Apply deep knowledge of cultural theories, including gestalt theory, to construct experiences that resonate with diverse user demographics and cultural backgrounds.5. AI Integration:* Leverage generative AI technologies to enhance product development and create innovative solutions that elevate user experiences.6. Ed-Tech Leadership:* Bring a wealth of expertise in the ed-tech domain, understanding the distinctive challenges and opportunities within the education technology industry.7. Unbiased Research:* Implement rigorous research methodologies to ensure unbiased collection and analysis of user insights, supporting data-driven design decisions.8. Creative and Operational Agility:* Demonstrate the ability to seamlessly transition between creative ideation and operational execution, ensuring the realization of cutting-edge design concepts.Qualifications and Skills:* Bachelor's or Master's degree in a relevant field such as Interaction Design, Human-Computer Interaction, or a related discipline.* Extensive proven experience in experience design, preferably within the ed-tech or related industry.* Proficiency in the adaptation of guidelines from cultural theory, gestalt theory, Flow theory, Hick’s/Fitt’s Law, Affordance theory, Emotional Design, and the application of these principles to features of a tech product.* Familiarity with generative AI tools and their practical application in product development.* Strong knowledge of research methodologies, including usability testing, user interviews, and A/B testing.* Exceptional creativity with a knack for innovative thinking while maintaining meticulous attention to detail.* Outstanding communication skills and the ability to verbalize the abstract and collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.* Flexibility and adaptability to navigate the dynamic intersection of creativity and operations.Job Type: Full TimeJob Location:F11, Islamabad/ OnsitePerks and Benefits: Staff LunchEmployee Insurance plan15 casual paid leaves10 medical paid leaves15 grant paid leaves90 paid maternity leaves15 Paternity leaves12 Dragon leavesPersonal enrichment programFlexible schedulesLoan assistanceEmployee recognition and rewardWellness program & and personal developmentMedical assistanceEOBI

Requisition ID:  req43561Job Title: Technical Advisor Environmental Health - AsiaSector: HealthEmployment Category: RegularEmployment Type: Full-TimeOpen to Expatriates: NoLocation: Bangkok, ThailandWork Arrangement Job Description Job DescriptionThe IRC’s vision is to lead the humanitarian field by implementing high-impact, cost-effective programs for people affected by crisis and by using our learning and experience to shape policy and practice. To achieve that vision, the IRC’s Technical Excellence (TE) provides technical assistance to IRC’s country program staff and shares what we learn to influence policy and practice.The TE has three central objectives that we work towards:  Guide program design to achieve outcomes by incorporating the best available evidenceBuild technical capacity of country program staff to implement, measure and continuously improve programsInfluence the IRC, peer agencies and donors to use proven interventions and generate new evidence to achieve change in peoples’ lives
TE is comprised of seven Technical Units, all of which have deep expertise in their respective sectors: Education, Economic Wellbeing, Gender Equality, Governance, Health, Violence Prevention and Response, and Research and Innovation (R&I).Environmental Health field programs are supported by a headquarters team of seven Technical Advisors supervised by the Senior Technical Advisor Environmental Health, ensuring quality programming related to water supply, sanitation, hygiene promotion and infection prevention and control (IPC). The EH team is situated institutionally within the Health Unit of IRC alongside Health (primary health care/reproductive health, mental health) and Nutrition.Specific Responsibilities Guiding Program DesignThe Environmental Health Technical Advisor (TA) will spend at least 80% of their time delivering technical assistance in-person and remotely to country program colleagues in countries in Asia. This is a primarily field facing position with the central responsibility focused on program quality. The remaining 0-20% of their time is spent on influence, advocacy, research and internal initiatives at the discretion of their supervisors. Technical Advisors' specific responsibilities are as follows: Support country program staff to design programs and projects, ensuring that they are:
oAligned with the IRC's strategy, which includes supporting country program staff with contextualizing outcomes and the theories of change, and selecting interventions based on the best available evidence and the local context;oResponsive to client needs and preferencesoBased on sound context and gender analysis Help define approach to teaming / partnering with other organizationsSupport selection of indicators for country programs
Engaging In Business Development Review technical quality of proposals, including review of technical activities and ensuring alignment to IRC's outcomesInput into go / no go decisions on proposalsWhen necessary, write technical narratives of proposalsProvide input on budgets required for project deliveryEngage with donors and do outreach in support of country programs
Building technical capacity of country program staff to ensure ongoing program quality and innovation:  Work with country program colleagues to help analyze data that inform periodic review and course correction as-neededShare cross-context learning with country program staff across the regionConduct technical training and ongoing technical coaching for country program staff, including on IRC outcomes, theories of change, evidence and indicatorsReview and share program-specific tools / resources / curricula and work with Technical Unit specialists to contextualize and adapt global and country-specific materialsSupport senior country program staff recruitment and onboarding
Influence the IRC, peer agencies and donors to use proven interventions and generate new evidence: Present IRC research findings across contexts and relevant conferences
Job QualificationsEducation: Master's/post-graduate degree in engineering and/or public health or relevant field or equivalent combination of education and experience is required. Participate in ongoing training courses and share knowledge and skill sets within the unit.Work Experience: A minimum of 6 to 8 years in implementing and/or managing Environmental Health or WASH programs is required, preferably also within a humanitarian, international development setting. Experience in technical tools and materials development, monitoring and evaluation, and research in relation to environmental health is highly desired. Experience in strategy development and working across sectors or disciplines is highly desired.Demonstrated Skills and Competencies: Demonstrated expertise in program design, monitoring and evaluation, with the ability to turn concepts and strategy into measurable action. Strong verbal and written communication skills. Demonstrated commitment to renewing and maintaining currency with best practices.Language Skills: Fluency in English is essential.Working Environment: Up to 40% travel may be required. This position will be based in Bangkok or Islamabad.All IRC staff are required to adhere to The IRC Way Standards for Professional Conduct and the IRC country employment policies.Commitment To Diversity And InclusivityIRC is committed to building a diverse organization and a climate of inclusivity. We strongly encourage applications from candidates who can demonstrate that they can contribute to this goal.Equal Opportunity EmployerWe are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Job Desception:
About the job
            

 
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?Are you a software engineer that thrives on complex challenges and is eager to make a real impact? Join our team where you'll be contributing to our strategic product line, that’s looking to reshape industries and change the way people work and learn.Our strategic product line includes: Crossover: An AI-powered hiring platform that sifts through millions of applicants per year to find the top 1% of global remote talent. We're breaking down geographical barriers and making high-paying jobs accessible to professionals worldwide, regardless of their location.gt.school: An online education platform that uses advanced data collection, algorithms, and AI-generated content to empower students to learn at their own pace. Our adaptive learning system fills knowledge gaps, accelerates learning, and helps students master a whole grade level on a subject within weeks.Data-driven Sales: This initiative leverages data and AI algorithms to streamline the sales process across a portfolio of over 100 software products. We're transitioning these products to a unified platform based on Salesforce and NetSuite, all while handling complex data imports, synchronization, modeling divergences and data inconsistencies.
What we offer: The opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies, including the latest in AWS serverless and no-code/low-code patterns.The opportunity to learn and experiment with using generative AI to boost your productivity.A team of exceptionally talented engineers from around the world as your peers.The chance to work on products that are reshaping industries and making a difference in people's lives.
We're not just using AI as a buzzword. We're at the start of a thrilling journey with generative AI, experimenting and learning to fully leverage its potential and free our engineers from mundane tasks, allowing them to focus on what truly matters: design, decision-making, and understanding the far-reaching implications of different implementation strategies.Showcase your skills, not just your resume. Take on our challenges: 15-min Cognitive, 90-min Coding, 120-min Technical Decision-Making. Excel and you'll face a decisive interview with our Hiring Manager. More than half walk away with an offer. Ready to unleash your potential? Apply today!What You Will Be Doing Developing cloud-native backends and implementing data processing algorithms using the latest serverless cloud patterns, including AWS.Review code to ensure adherence to best practices, team standards, and customer requirements.
What You Won’t Be Doing Spending time on minor bug fixes or features in outdated codebases.Dealing with tedious infrastructure to keep poorly written products running.Getting stuck in endless meetings discussing roadmaps and priorities or chasing people around.
Basic RequirementsSoftware Development Engineer key responsibilities At least 4 years of experience writing production code for the server side of web applications.At least 2 years of experience being the primary technical contributor for a development team OR software product.At least 1 year of hands-on experience developing using cloud patterns (any cloud vendor).An openness to learn to use generative A.I. in your day-to-day development work.
Nice-to-have Requirements Experience in using generative A.I. in your day-to-day development work.
About TrilogyHundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!Working with CrossoverThis is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $50 USD/hour, which equates to $100,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.What to expect next: You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.
Important! If you do not receive an email from us: First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.

Job Desception:
About the job
            

 
We are looking for a Release Management Engineer for our client who will be responsible for planning, coordination and execution of planned software releases. This position entails handling of DevOps team responsible for automated CI/CD deployments. Key Requirements: Responsible for the Release Management lifecycle that involves the stages such as release planning, scheduling the release, coordinating between teams, and deployment of release as per the schedule and within budget.Will have to deploy builds to Dev/SIT/UAT/Testing environments and release the software after completing the testing stage and deployment stage, and work closely with the application development team, testing team, and production team.Concerned with planning, testing, tracking, release, deployment, communication, and risk management.Maintain documentation related to procedures on build and release, various notifications list, and dependencies.Team up with relevant development teams responsible for building the automation tools used to develop and deploy the software.Schedule the release readiness reviews before deployment and milestone reviews after each release.Make improvements in the methodologies used for configuration management and development of software that helps to find ways to use in configuration management.Coordinate the release schedule and resources required depending upon the third-party applications, defect backlogs, planned releases, and infrastructure updates.Identify the risks that can delay the release and manage them, such that the scope scheduled, and quality of the release are not affected.Build release and deployment dashboards for CI/CD to measure deployment success and usage.Execute, control, and manage a schedule of planned releases to pre-production and production environments.- Liaise with Operations to resource the installation of software onto pre-product and production environments and keep them up to date. This includes maintaining the scale between pre-prod and prod.Work with QA, Development, and Operations to ensure that development projects adhere to the release process and change procedure guidelines. 
Skills Required:Technical Skills:·         Proficiency in version control systems (e.g., Git, SVN).·         Extensive knowledge of CI/CD tools and automation (e.g., Jenkins, GitLab CI/CD, Ansible).·         Familiarity with containerization and orchestration technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).·         Strong scripting and automation skills (e.g., Python, Bash).Certifications: Relevant certifications in release management, DevOps, or related areas are a plus (e.g., Certified Release Manager, AWS DevOps Engineer, Docker Certified Associate).Communication and Collaboration: Excellent communication, teamwork, and interpersonal skills to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.Problem-Solving: Strong problem-solving abilities to address unexpected issues and challenges during the release process.Attention to Detail: Meticulous attention to detail to ensure precise tracking and documentation of releases.Experience:The ideal candidate for this role should possess a minimum of 5 years of experience in the software development, release, and configuration management field. Specifically, they should have: A track record of at least two years as a Configuration and/or Release Engineer.Demonstrated expertise in implementing ITIL best practices, particularly in Release Management, Configuration Management, and Change Management.Proficiency in Configuration Management, including familiarity with Unix/Linux environments.Strong analytical and critical thinking skills, with the ability to solve problems effectively in an agile manner.Excellent coordination skills to manage the diverse needs of internal and external stakeholders.Knowledge and experience with various vendors, enterprise applications, large relational databases, and distributed infrastructures (e.g., ERP applications).Familiarity with multiple Release Management software tools.Exceptional attention to detail, self-motivation, and the ability to work independently with minimal supervision, while upholding high-quality standards throughout the release process.Proven experience in Agile development environments.An ITIL Foundation certification would be a valuable asset.Familiarity with specific technologies such as IBM FileNet (or similar enterprise-scale Content Management applications), IBM AS400, IBM Tivoli, WebSphere, and highly distributed UNIX and JAVA platforms.Working knowledge of source control tools like Aldon, TFS, GitLab, Code Analytics tools, or similar platforms.Previous experience in either operations or development roles.Experience with modern source control, packaging, and software release tools and methodologies.
Job Context:  Ensuring Testing Adherence: The primary focus is to make sure that testing activities align with the defined scope of the application, system, or related components. This involves closely following established testing processes and ensuring that team members adhere to these processes.Production Reliability: Another crucial aspect is guaranteeing the reliability and consistency of systems when they are deployed to the production environment. This means that the candidate will play a role in ensuring that software or applications work smoothly and consistently in a live production setting, minimizing disruptions.Team Skill Enhancement: The role includes a commitment to improving the technical skills of the team members. This involves mentoring, facilitating self-learning using learning and development resources, and participating in internal and external training opportunities. Sharing industry experiences is also encouraged to enhance the team's overall expertise.
How to Apply:Interested candidates are invited to submit their resume, portfolio (optional), and a cover letter (optional) explaining their qualifications, and relevant experience to Jobs@aiitsolutions.com. Only short list candidates will be contacted for an interview.
